shows.title: Severance
shows.scoring_notes: UPDATE: Season 2 confirms brilliance. Adam Scott, Britt Lower, John Turturro, Christopher Walken deliver masterclass performances. World-building of Lumon is unmatched. S2 expands mythology while maintaining mystery.

shows.title: When Life Gives You Tangerines
shows.scoring_notes: Netflix Korean phenomenon. IU and Park Bo-gum deliver career-best performances. TMDB 8.7 reflects quality.

shows.title: The Leftovers
shows.scoring_notes: Damon Lindelof's masterpiece. 2% of world's population vanishes in Sudden Departure. Justin Theroux and Carrie Coon deliver career-best performances. Explores grief, faith, and meaning with devastating precision. S2 'International Assassin' episode is legendary. Complete three-season arc with perfect finale. One of the greatest TV dramas ever made.

shows.title: Pachinko
shows.scoring_notes: Sweeping multi-generational Korean family saga. Min Jin Lee adaptation spanning Japan-occupied Korea to 1980s Japan. Youn Yuh-jung and Lee Min-ho lead. Trilingual masterpiece about identity, survival, and legacy. Stunning cinematography across timelines. Two seasons, ongoing. Apple's best drama.

shows.title: Maniac
shows.scoring_notes: Cary Fukunaga's visual triumph. Emma Stone and Jonah Hill in pharmaceutical trial that bends reality. Each episode a different genre/style. Stunning retro-futuristic production design. Limited series, complete narrative.

shows.title: Happy Valley
shows.scoring_notes: Sarah Lancashire's career-defining performance as Sgt. Catherine Cawood. Yorkshire crime drama with rare emotional depth. Explores trauma, addiction, and family with unflinching honesty. James Norton's villain is chilling. Three perfect seasons with devastating and satisfying conclusion. British crime at its absolute peak.

shows.title: Counterpart
shows.scoring_notes: Underrated gem. JK Simmons playing dual versions of himself. Cold War Berlin atmosphere with multiverse concept. Canceled after 2 seasons but arc feels complete. Critical darling.

shows.title: Mindhunter
shows.scoring_notes: David Fincher's true crime masterpiece. CANCELED after 2 seasons.

shows.title: Mindhunter
shows.scoring_notes: David Fincher's true crime masterpiece. CANCELED after 2 seasons.

shows.title: The Night Of
shows.scoring_notes: HBO limited series. Riz Ahmed's breakout as Naz. John Turturro unforgettable as Stone. Gritty NYC crime exploring justice system. Zaillian's direction is meticulous.

shows.title: The Sandman
shows.scoring_notes: Neil Gaiman's magnum opus. Tom Sturridge captures Dream perfectly. Exceptional world-building across realms. Extremely conceptually dense. Resolution incomplete.

shows.title: The Sandman
shows.scoring_notes: Neil Gaiman's magnum opus. Exceptional world-building across realms.

shows.title: Broadchurch
shows.scoring_notes: David Tennant and Olivia Colman as detectives in small coastal town. Young boy's murder tears community apart. Stunning Dorset cinematography. S1 is perfect mystery storytelling. S2 focuses on courtroom, S3 on new case. Complete three-season arc. Essential British crime drama.

shows.title: Severance S1 (Standalone Analysis)
shows.scoring_notes: Season 1 standalone analysis. Perfect establishment of Lumon's world. Adam Scott's Innies and Outties create compelling dual performance. The finale 'The We We Are' is breathtaking television. Note: Full series with S2 is at #11 (8.63).

shows.title: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms
shows.scoring_notes: GoT spinoff following Dunk & Egg. Peter Claffey and Dexter Sol Ansell deliver strong performances. Intimate and episodic.

shows.title: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms
shows.scoring_notes: GoT spinoff following Dunk & Egg. Intimate and episodic.

shows.title: Mrs. Davis
shows.scoring_notes: Damon Lindelof's latest. Betty Gilpin as nun vs. all-powerful AI. Utterly bonkers premise executed with heart and intelligence. Explores faith, technology, human connection. Single season complete story. Less emotionally devastating than Leftovers but equally ambitious. Peacock's best original.

shows.title: Devs
shows.scoring_notes: Alex Garland's limited series. Sonoya Mizuno investigates quantum computing conspiracy. Visually stunning cinematography. Dense philosophical concepts about determinism and free will. Intellectually rewarding.

shows.title: Top of the Lake
shows.scoring_notes: Jane Campion's mystery masterpiece. Elisabeth Moss as detective investigating missing pregnant girl in New Zealand. Stunning landscapes, deeply atmospheric. S2 (China Girl) shifts to Sydney with Nicole Kidman. Unique female gaze on crime genre. Complete two-season arc.

shows.title: The Missing
shows.scoring_notes: James Nesbitt as father searching for son abducted in France. Dual timeline structure across years is masterful. Each season standalone with new case. Tcheky Karyo as detective Baptiste is magnetic. Emotionally devastating but complete. Some of the most intense television made.

shows.title: The Bear S2
shows.scoring_notes: Season 2 expansion into restaurant opening. 'Forks' and 'Fishes' episodes showcase range. Jamie Lee Curtis guest appearance is devastating. More character-focused than S1's panic attack. Builds toward something beautiful. Major jump in quality.

shows.title: The Night Manager
shows.scoring_notes: John le Carr√© adaptation. Tom Hiddleston excels as Pine, Hugh Laurie chilling as Roper. Elegant international espionage. Lush cinematic cinematography. Award-winning British thriller.

shows.title: Utopia (UK)
shows.scoring_notes: UK conspiracy thriller masterpiece. Graphic novel 'The Utopia Experiments' predicts global catastrophes. Stunning neon-soaked cinematography and Cristobal Tapia de Veer's score is iconic. Brutal violence, complex plotting. CANCELED after S2 on massive cliffhanger. Essential despite incomplete resolution.

shows.title: Tehran
shows.scoring_notes: Israeli spy thriller. Niv Sultan as Mossad agent in Iran. Tense cat-and-mouse espionage. Authentic locations and cultural detail. Strong second season with Glen Close. Apple's best international production.

shows.title: The Rehearsal
shows.scoring_notes: Nathan Fielder helps people rehearse difficult life moments with elaborate simulations. Unclassifiable blend of comedy, reality, and existential dread. Meta-commentary on performance and authenticity. Two seasons, ongoing. Unlike anything else on television.

shows.title: Station Eleven
shows.scoring_notes: Post-pandemic adaptation of Emily St. John Mandel novel. Traveling Shakespeare troupe in devastated world. Nonlinear storytelling weaves timelines beautifully. Mackenzie Davis and Himesh Patel lead. About art, survival, human connection. HBO Max limited series, complete and haunting.

shows.title: House of the Dragon
shows.scoring_notes: GoT prequel covering Targaryen civil war. Emma D'Arcy and Olivia Cooke excel as rival queens. Matt Smith as Daemon is magnetic. Dragons and politics return to form. Strong recovery for franchise.

shows.title: Fallout
shows.scoring_notes: Amazon gaming adaptation. Strong world-building and spectacle.

shows.title: Reservation Dogs
shows.scoring_notes: Indigenous teens in rural Oklahoma planning to escape to California. Sterlin Harjo's authentic Native storytelling. All-Indigenous writers room and cast. Three seasons of humor, grief, and community. Complete series, perfect ending. Revolutionary television.

shows.title: The Fall
shows.scoring_notes: Gillian Anderson as DCI Stella Gibson hunting Jamie Dornan's serial killer in Belfast. Psychological duel between investigator and predator. Unflinching look at violence against women. Anderson's performance is iconic. Three seasons with definitive conclusion.

shows.title: Silo
shows.scoring_notes: Apple's dystopian mystery. Rebecca Ferguson leads in underground silo society. Atmospheric world-building, slow-burn revelations. Based on Hugh Howey novels. S2 expands scope magnificently. Ongoing but strong trajectory. Some of Apple's best sci-fi.

shows.title: The White Lotus
shows.scoring_notes: Mike White's social satire at luxury resorts. S1 Hawaii, S2 Sicily, S3 Thailand. Murder mystery framework explores wealth, privilege, colonialism. Jennifer Coolidge's Tanya is iconic. Each season standalone with new cast. Ongoing anthology of class critique.

shows.title: Andor
shows.scoring_notes: Diego Luna as Cassian Andor in Rogue One prequel. Mature, grounded Star Wars for adults. Tony Gilroy brings espionage thriller sensibility. Best Star Wars television by significant margin.

shows.title: The Diplomat
shows.scoring_notes: Keri Russell as ambassador. Political intrigue, strong characters.

shows.title: The End of the F***ing World
shows.scoring_notes: British dark comedy. Alex Lawther and Jessica Barden as teen misfits on road trip. Stunning cinematography for TV. Sharp writing balances darkness with humor. Complete two-season story with perfect ending.

shows.title: Russian Doll
shows.scoring_notes: Natasha Lyonne's time-loop masterpiece. Sharply written, darkly comic. Nadia's journey through mortality and trauma is profound. S2 expands scope into family history. Inventive visual style. Complete two-season arc.

shows.title: Yellowjackets
shows.scoring_notes: Melanie Lynskey, Juliette Lewis, Christina Ricci in dual-timeline survival horror. Teen soccer team stranded in wilderness, adult survivors haunted by secrets. Bold, atmospheric, deeply weird. Three seasons, ongoing. Some of the most compelling female characters on TV.

shows.title: The OA
shows.scoring_notes: Brit Marling's ambitious mystical sci-fi. Prairie's return after 7 years missing is just the beginning. Unique movement-based storytelling. S2 expands into mind-bending multiverse. CANCELED on massive cliffhanger ‚Äî resolution severely impacted. Cult following, deeply divisive.

shows.title: The Bear S1
shows.scoring_notes: Jeremy Allen White as chef returning to run family sandwich shop in Chicago. S1 is anxiety-inducing intensity. 'Fishes' episode is legendary single-take chaos. Culinary workplace drama like nothing else.

shows.title: The Sinner
shows.scoring_notes: Anthology mystery. Bill Pullman's Ambrose through 4 seasons. Jessica Biel's S1 set the tone. Why-not-whodunit approach. Quality varies by season.

shows.title: The Outsider
shows.scoring_notes: Stephen King adaptation. Ben Mendelsohn and Cynthia Erivo lead. Starts as procedural, shifts to supernatural horror. Atmospheric dread throughout. Pacing issues but strong finale.

shows.title: Luther
shows.scoring_notes: Idris Elba as brilliant but self-destructive DCI John Luther. Ruth Wilson's Alice Morgan is unforgettable antagonist/ally. Gritty London crime with psychological depth. Five seasons plus movie. Elba's performance anchors the chaos. British crime at its most intense.

shows.title: Bad Sisters
shows.scoring_notes: Sharon Horgan's dark comedy about five Irish sisters covering up a murder. Claes Bang as despicable husband. Sharp writing on family bonds and female solidarity. S2 shifts focus while maintaining quality. Apple's most entertaining series.

shows.title: Slow Horses
shows.scoring_notes: Gary Oldman leads MI5 rejects in Slough House. Witty spy thriller based on Mick Herron novels. Jack Lowden and Kristin Scott Thomas excel. Four seasons of increasing quality. British espionage with sharp humor and genuine stakes. Ongoing but consistent excellence.
